name: Julie Guest House

reviews.text: I stayed here for 5 nights in May 07 and although the rooms arn't fantastic, the atmosphere of the place really makes up for it.
reviews.title: Great place for Backpackers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are very friendly and will book trips and travel for you.
reviews.title: Horrible!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What I loved most about Julies was the vibe - there are a couple of cool chill out areas where you can get really good food and share stories/experiences with other travellers - it is mainly a guesthouse for backpackers on the move, rather than a place for couples/people who may be seeking somewhere a bit quieter or more upmarket.
reviews.title: Fantastic Value

reviews.text: Me and my boyfriend were supposed to be staying at Julies for 5 nights however we left after 1 night and stayed at the Lai Thai Guesthouse. I booked one of the superior rooms which I was told were large however when we arrived the room was tiny and you had to almost stand on the toilet to have a shower. The room was dirty, the windows and mosquito guards would not close and there was music playing right outside our window until 3am so we got no sleep! There are no staff around after 8pm so do not expect a drink or directions to anywhere or access to you safe!
reviews.title: You can only have the better rooms if you book a tour

likes.liked: — The en-suite rooms are fantastic value for money. Clean and spacious.
likes.disliked: — The shared bathroom rooms are horrid, dirty, noisey and bathrooms not clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my boyfriend stayed in Julie's for 3 nights in Feb 2007 during our 2 week holiday to Thailand. We paid approximately €6 for a garden room. It was painted in nice bright colours - small but perfect for what you pay there was no complaints. The chill out area is fab. We had our dinner brought to us here where there are hammocks and cushions all around the place and nice nightlights. We also booked a tour through Julies - the 1 day trek which was great. The location is great - its really quiet but only 10mins walk to the gates. We paid 50B to get to the night Bazaar by tuk tuk. There are massage parlours around the corner from Julie's where we got fab leg massages and Thai herbal massages.
reviews.title: Fantastic value for money!!
Excellent value for money
reviews.text: I stayed here at the end of January 2007. I got a room for 130 baht a night. It was clean, reasonably sized, double bed, cupboard for clothes, and an en suite bathroom which had cold water. This was not really a problem as I was allowed to use the shared bathroom for the dorm rooms which did have hot water. If you'd like a room with hot water, then I suggest you book ahead. I tried to but the deluxe rooms were already booked out.

The guesthouse is in a good location, about a 10 minute walk away from all the bars and nightlife, so it is quite quiet. The staff are very helpful and I signed up for one of their adventure tours. Elephant trekking, white water rafting, bamboo rafting, a trek through jungle to a waterfall, and also a visit to an orchid farm - all for 1100 baht. Be careful with the white water rafting, our raft capsized and I smashed my head and knee against rocks. Luckily for my head I was wearing a helmet. Also, the temperature is not too hot this time of year, so it can be quite cool on the river - bring a sweater or a change of water. Our raft was waterlogged and sank.
reviews.title: Fantastic Find

reviews.text: The guesthouse also helped me book my train ticket back to Bangkok for a 70 baht booking fee.
reviews.title: Fantastic guest house and people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at Julies in March, and found the room to be decent especially for the price. 350 Bhat per night.
reviews.title: Julies was decent for the price.

likes.disliked: — could be slightly cleaner. It would be nice if they had the option of AC for a higher price.

reviews.text: We had en suite which probably helped with the experience compared to people that share the facilities.
reviews.title: Stay away! Only their profit counts!

reviews.text: The room was clean, although we chose to use our own sheets.
reviews.title: Just For Posh Backpackers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I could tell that the sheets were washed, but were noticeably worn.
reviews.title: RUDE staff, DIRTY rooms

reviews.text: This property has a nice lounge area in the back which was great in the mid afternoon when it was just too hot to be out and about.
reviews.title: good if you book the en suite rooms

aka: Julie Guest House Hotel Chiang Mai
